column4: this is strange...for some reason the system is dropping the driver for the dvd  or its being stopped by something  at least it sounds that way/// you could check in some of the logs to see what is going on but I am not real good at problem solving dvd players
which log to look at though? im not good with sifting thru logs.. what titles should I look thru?
good question I am searching now but which specific model of laptop is this?
ASUS, with an LG drive if that helps
I will try to search this   no guarantees  :)  hold on
np mate, I appreciate the help.. although my contacts are drying up something fierce
does this only happen when trying to burn with brasero?
no, it happens when Im ripping a CD or DVD to an ISO with Brasero or any other application, not usually when burning
ok but you have tried other applications for this as well?
its unusable right now.. if you have some command to run to try and reuse it or some other test lol, I can troubleshoot it now.. When I restart it works again
out of curiosity the dvds you are trying to rip when this happens i asume the region code is  for your region??  just a  thought
yes, they are.. Some are personal DVD backups of just personal data and not encrypted or copyrighted
ok it was just a though thinking the dvd player itself may be set to a different region code
I am coming up with nothing guy  sorry  I am going to suggest  #linux  also  if you havent tried there
no problem just give #linux channel a shot  a couple times  in case  someone is not there right now
